page.content: DRUGS ABUSE IN CHESHAM. Regional health chiefs are to seek more than a quarter of a million pounds in Government aid to help combat serious drugs abuse in the area,where the number of addicts has been estimated at about 600.The prob- lem is the lack of people and places to wipe out the abuse.It is estimated that Â£231000 is spent a year on drugs in this area.The money needed to help the addicts reaches a total of 52500. At the moment the only help the addicts can get is from the family docter and local psychiatrists.If we don't do something soon to stop drug abuse,an alarming number of inhabitants of Chesham,may become addicts.
